P.title: Will humans go extinct before 2100?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2100, the human population falls below 1,000 individuals worldwide, as reported by at least three independent and reputable scientific organizations. The criteria for human extinction must include the inability to sustain a viable population due to factors such as global catastrophic events, widespread infertility, or other phenomena leading to the cessation of human birth and survival. In the absence of direct population counts, corroborating evidence from multiple sources, including satellite imagery, AI predictive models, and on-the-ground reports, may be used to infer population levels. If no reliable data is available due to global communication breakdown or other unforeseen circumstances, the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

para_P.title: Will the human species become extinct before the year 2100?
para_P.body: This forecast will be affirmed as Yes if the global human count drops below 1,000 individuals by January 1, 2100, as verified by at least three independent and credible scientific bodies. Extinction criteria must encompass the inability to maintain a sustainable population due to severe global events, pervasive infertility, or similar factors that halt human reproduction and survival. In the absence of direct population figures, supplementary evidence from various sources such as satellite data, AI projections, and field reports may be utilized to estimate population numbers. Should there be a lack of dependable data owing to a complete breakdown in global communications or other unexpected events, the outcome will be deemed Ambiguous.

P.title: Will humans go extinct before 2100?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2100, the human population falls below 1,000 individuals worldwide, as reported by at least three independent and reputable scientific organizations. The criteria for human extinction must include the inability to sustain a viable population due to factors such as global catastrophic events, widespread infertility, or other phenomena leading to the cessation of human birth and survival. In the absence of direct population counts, corroborating evidence from multiple sources, including satellite imagery, AI predictive models, and on-the-ground reports, may be used to infer population levels. If no reliable data is available due to global communication breakdown or other unforeseen circumstances, the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P.title: Will we discover clear evidence of proton decay by 2040?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, there is a peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific journal, such as Nature or Physical Review Letters, that presents clear evidence of proton decay, confirmed by at least one independent replication study. The evidence must be widely accepted by the scientific community, with no significant controversy regarding the validity of the findings. The discovery must be based on experimental data from a recognized scientific facility, such as the Super-Kamiokande or any successor experiment specifically designed to detect proton decay. Theoretical papers or unconfirmed experimental results will not be considered sufficient for resolution. In the event that multiple discoveries are reported, the date of the first publication will be used to determine the resolution. If no such evidence is presented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: By the end of 2040, will definitive proof of proton decay have been established?
para_P.body: This forecast will be affirmed as Yes if, by the close of December 31, 2040, there exists a peer-reviewed article in a prestigious scientific journal, such as Nature or Physical Review Letters, that provides definitive proof of proton decay, corroborated by at least one independent verification study. The proof must gain broad acceptance within the scientific community without substantial dispute over the validity of the results. The discovery should be grounded in experimental data from a recognized scientific institution, like Super-Kamiokande or any subsequent facility aimed at detecting proton decay. Only experimental findings will be considered; theoretical studies or unverified experimental outcomes will not qualify. If multiple findings are reported, the date of the initial publication will determine the outcome. If no such proof is presented by the deadline, the forecast will resolve as No.

P.title: Will we discover clear evidence of proton decay by 2040?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, there is a peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific journal, such as Nature or Physical Review Letters, that presents clear evidence of proton decay, confirmed by at least one independent replication study. The evidence must be widely accepted by the scientific community, with no significant controversy regarding the validity of the findings. The discovery must be based on experimental data from a recognized scientific facility, such as the Super-Kamiokande or any successor experiment specifically designed to detect proton decay. Theoretical papers or unconfirmed experimental results will not be considered sufficient for resolution. In the event that multiple discoveries are reported, the date of the first publication will be used to determine the resolution. If no such evidence is presented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

P.title: Will the richest person in the world in 2033 have a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, on December 31, 2033, the net worth of the richest person in the world, as listed by Forbes' annual billionaires list, is equal to or exceeds 2% of the United States' Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for the year 2033. The GDP will be determined based on the data released by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) of the U.S. Department of Commerce. In the event that Forbes does not release a billionaires list for the year 2033, the resolution will be based on the most widely recognized and credible alternative source available at the time. If the BEA has not released the GDP data for 2033 by December 31, 2033, the resolution will be based on the most recent and reliable estimate available from a recognized economic research institution. In the case of any discrepancies between sources or lack of clear data, the question will be resolved by a panel of economic experts, whose decision will be final.

para_P.title: By the end of 2033, will the world's wealthiest individual possess a fortune that equals or surpasses 2% of the U.S. GDP?
para_P.body: This forecast will be affirmed as Yes if, by December 31, 2033, the world's wealthiest person, according to Forbes' annual billionaires list, has a net worth that meets or exceeds 2% of the United States' Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for that year, as reported by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) of the U.S. Department of Commerce. Should Forbes fail to publish a billionaires list for 2033, the resolution will rely on the most reputable and accepted alternative source available. If the BEA has not disclosed the GDP figures for 2033 by the end of the year, the resolution will depend on the latest and most credible GDP estimate from a recognized economic research body. In situations where data discrepancies arise or clear data is unavailable, a panel of economic experts will make the final decision on the resolution.

P.title: Will the richest person in the world in 2033 have a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, on December 31, 2033, the net worth of the richest person in the world, as listed by Forbes' annual billionaires list, is equal to or exceeds 2% of the United States' Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for the year 2033. The GDP will be determined based on the data released by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) of the U.S. Department of Commerce. In the event that Forbes does not release a billionaires list for the year 2033, the resolution will be based on the most widely recognized and credible alternative source available at the time. If the BEA has not released the GDP data for 2033 by December 31, 2033, the resolution will be based on the most recent and reliable estimate available from a recognized economic research institution. In the case of any discrepancies between sources or lack of clear data, the question will be resolved by a panel of economic experts, whose decision will be final.

P.title: Ragnarök Question Series: If a global catastrophe occurs, will it be due to nuclear war?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
In the headline question to this series, I defined a global catastrophe as a 10% decrease in the world population in any period of 5 years.
If a global catastrophe happens before 2100, will it be principally due to the deployment of nuclear weapons?
Show More

para_P.title: Series on Apocalyptic Events: Will nuclear conflict be the cause of a worldwide disaster?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
In the primary question of this series, a worldwide disaster is characterized by a reduction of at least 10% in the global population over any five-year span.
Should such a disaster occur before the year 2100, will it be primarily attributed to the use of nuclear armaments?
Show More

P.title: Ragnarök Question Series: If a global catastrophe occurs, will it be due to nuclear war?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
In the headline question to this series, I defined a global catastrophe as a 10% decrease in the world population in any period of 5 years.
If a global catastrophe happens before 2100, will it be principally due to the deployment of nuclear weapons?
Show More

metadata.background_info:
You can now see an excellent visualization of global catastrophic risks estimates produced in the Ragnarök series here.
The invention of nuclear weapons gave humanity the technical capacity to cause devastation on a hitherto unseen scale. Although there have been no nuclear attacks since the Second World War, we have come close to inadvertent and intentional nuclear war on a number of occasions.
The Cuban Missile Crisis of October 1962 was a direct and dangerous confrontation between the United States and the Soviet Union during the Cold War and was the moment when the two nuclear superpowers came closest to nuclear conflict. U.S. president John F. Kennedy estimated the odds of nuclear war at "somewhere between one out of three and even".
Show More

P.title: Will Tesla become the largest car company in the world (by sales) before 2035?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if Tesla Motors is the largest car producer in the world at any point before January 1, 2035, according to global car sales data from the International Organization of Motor Vehicle Manufacturers.
If data from OICA is not available during this period, Metaculus may select an alternative credible source of data, or resolve as at their discretion
Show More

para_P.title: Before the year 2035, will Tesla surpass all other automobile manufacturers to become the top global car seller?
para_P.body: The outcome will be affirmative if, at any time prior to January 1, 2035, Tesla Motors achieves the highest worldwide car sales figures, as reported by the International Organization of Motor Vehicle Manufacturers (OICA). Should OICA data be inaccessible during this timeframe, Metaculus may rely on a different reputable data source or determine the resolution based on their judgment.

P.title: Will Tesla become the largest car company in the world (by sales) before 2035?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if Tesla Motors is the largest car producer in the world at any point before January 1, 2035, according to global car sales data from the International Organization of Motor Vehicle Manufacturers.
If data from OICA is not available during this period, Metaculus may select an alternative credible source of data, or resolve as at their discretion
Show More

metadata.background_info:
While Tesla is already a very large automobile company based on market capitalisation, a lot of that market capitalisation is based on expectations of the future. As of the writing of this question, Tesla is losing money and selling significantly less cars than even the 20th largest auto-company in the world. Yet, the expectations that have been set for Tesla by Elon Musk would probably require Tesla to sell more cars than any other company on the planet while maintaining large profit-margins.
In order to ramp-up production from approx. 100,000 to 500,000 or 1,000,000 cars a year, Tesla has created the Model 3, its first mass market car. Regrettably, Tesla has had trouble producing the Model 3 and production of the car can be tracked here. It is likely that Tesla's total vehicle production must exceed 10 million in order for it to become the world's largest car company. Yet, given its financial situation, there is a risk that the company goes bankrupt before that happens.

P.title: Will AI progress surprise us by predictions of AGI jumping sharply?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
What is the likelihood of discontinuous progress around the development of Human Level Machine Intelligence (i.e. machines that can accomplish a wide range of important tasks at least as good as human experts)?
This question resolves as YES if both the Metaculus prediction odds and the community prediction odds of a positive resolution to at least triple within any two-month period before its close date, and otherwise.
Show More

para_P.title: Is a sudden leap in AGI predictions expected to astonish us?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
What are the chances for abrupt advancements in the creation of Human-Level Artificial General Intelligence (AGI), defined as machines capable of performing a broad spectrum of significant tasks at a level equal to or surpassing human experts?
This question will be resolved as YES if there is a tripling of the Metaculus prediction odds and the community prediction odds for a positive outcome within any two-month span before the question's closing date, and NO otherwise.
Show More

P.title: Will AI progress surprise us by predictions of AGI jumping sharply?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
What is the likelihood of discontinuous progress around the development of Human Level Machine Intelligence (i.e. machines that can accomplish a wide range of important tasks at least as good as human experts)?
This question resolves as YES if both the Metaculus prediction odds and the community prediction odds of a positive resolution to at least triple within any two-month period before its close date, and otherwise.
Show More

metadata.background_info:
Discontinuity in progress occurs when a particular technological advance pushes some progress metric substantially above what would be expected based on extrapolating past progress. If AI progress is unusually lumpy, i.e., arriving in unusually fewer larger packages rather than in the usual many smaller packages, then future progress might arrive faster than we would expect by simply looking at past progress. Moreover, if one AI team finds a big lump, it might jump way ahead of the other teams. According to AI Impacts, discontinuity on the path to AGI, lends itself to:
A party gaining decisive strategic advantage
A single important ‘deployment’ event
Other very sudden and surprising events

A did a good job operationalising Human-machine intelligence parity. It proposes a generalised intelligence test that compares machine systems to human experts in each of physics, mathematics and computer science. Using this, we can define a surprising discontinuity in AI progress as a tripling of the (given by p/(1-p)) in both the Metaculus prediction and community prediction within a 2-month period.
Show More

P.title: Will PsiQuantum have a commercial quantum computer by 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively via PsiQuantum company report that they have a quantum computer for sale by 2025

para_P.title: By the year 2025, will PsiQuantum offer a quantum computer for commercial purchase?
para_P.body: The question will be resolved affirmatively if PsiQuantum announces the availability of a quantum computer for commercial acquisition by the year 2025.

P.title: Will PsiQuantum have a commercial quantum computer by 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively via PsiQuantum company report that they have a quantum computer for sale by 2025

metadata.background_info:
In early 2021, the firm PsiQuantum announced that they plan on having a commercial quantum computer by 2025. The PsiQuantum computer, named "the Q-1", uses a 'photon qubit' approach as opposed to a 'matter qubit'. According to PsiQuantum,
There are many ways to make small numbers of qubits, but only one way to scale beyond 1,000,000 qubits and deliver an error corrected, fault tolerant general purpose quantum computer – and that is photonics.
Today, after numerous breakthroughs and advances in quantum architecture and silicon photonics, we uniquely have a clear path to building a useful quantum computer.
In 2020, PsiQuantum completed Series C funding of $150M bringing their total funding to $215M. Their list of investors includes BlackRock, Microsoft's Venture Fund, and Founders Fund.
Show More

P.title: By the year 2100, will any jurisdiction enforce requirements for all births to be genetically engineered?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2100, any jurisdiction passes any law(s) requiring all births to eliminate or promote certain gene(s) through gene editing techniques. "Gene editing techniques" means here CRISPR/Cas9, or any techniques which directly and selectively modify targeted genes. The genetic engineering techniques may occur at any time in the individual's lifespan, including before birth, after birth, or before conception. This question will only include jurisdictions which govern a population of at least 1 million people at the time the law is in effect.
Show More

para_P.title: Will there be a mandate for compulsory genetic modification of all newborns in any region by 2100?
para_P.body: This question will be affirmed if, from January 1, 2020, to January 1, 2100, any governing body with a population of at least one million implements legislation that mandates the genetic engineering of every newborn to add or remove specific genes using gene-editing technologies such as CRISPR/Cas9 or any other method that allows for precise and targeted genetic alterations. The genetic interventions may be applied prenatally, postnatally, or preconception.

P.title: By the year 2100, will any jurisdiction enforce requirements for all births to be genetically engineered?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2100, any jurisdiction passes any law(s) requiring all births to eliminate or promote certain gene(s) through gene editing techniques. "Gene editing techniques" means here CRISPR/Cas9, or any techniques which directly and selectively modify targeted genes. The genetic engineering techniques may occur at any time in the individual's lifespan, including before birth, after birth, or before conception. This question will only include jurisdictions which govern a population of at least 1 million people at the time the law is in effect.
Show More

metadata.background_info:
Our genes are the biologically encoded information from which we are built. Important traits known to be affected by our genes include aspects of intelligence and mental illness. Many physical traits, such as height, attractiveness, strength, and even longevity likewise strongly depend on the genes we have.
As the human genome and related human biological areas of inquiry became better understood, genetic engineering has become known. In the case of traits affected by simple genetic factors, it has been possible for years to change these genes, and the resulting trait(s) expressed, by means such as CRISPR/Cas9.
The pace of genetic engineering research, as measured by papers published worldwide, shows a clear trend to be growing. There is every reason to believe that as a result of this research trend, genetic engineering technology will tend to become safer, more powerful, and less expensive with time.
Show More

P.title: Will Stephen Wolfram, Jonathan Gorard, or Max Piskunov receive the Nobel prize in physics before 2036?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if Stephen Wolfram, or Jonathan Gorard, or Max Piskunov win the nobel prize in physics before January 1, 2036. For a positive resolution, the Nobel Prize committee must refer to work published by any of these individuals that is directly related to the 2020 Wolfram Physics Project. By "related to the 2020 Wolfram Physics Project", we mean that the work must build on a similar approach or set of insights as those explored in the Wolfram Physics Project, as judged by Metaculus admin
Show More

para_P.title: By the year 2036, will either Stephen Wolfram, Jonathan Gorard, or Max Piskunov have been awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics?
para_P.body: The question will be resolved affirmatively if, by January 1, 2036, any of the mentioned individuals—Stephen Wolfram, Jonathan Gorard, or Max Piskunov—receives the Nobel Prize in Physics. The award must acknowledge work that is directly associated with the Wolfram Physics Project initiated in 2020. The term 'associated with' implies that the recognized work should be based on a methodology or insights akin to those of the Wolfram Physics Project, as determined by Metaculus admin.

P.title: Will Stephen Wolfram, Jonathan Gorard, or Max Piskunov receive the Nobel prize in physics before 2036?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if Stephen Wolfram, or Jonathan Gorard, or Max Piskunov win the nobel prize in physics before January 1, 2036. For a positive resolution, the Nobel Prize committee must refer to work published by any of these individuals that is directly related to the 2020 Wolfram Physics Project. By "related to the 2020 Wolfram Physics Project", we mean that the work must build on a similar approach or set of insights as those explored in the Wolfram Physics Project, as judged by Metaculus admin
Show More

metadata.background_info: In the Wolfram Physics Project, Stephen Wolfram and co-authors have proposed a class of models to represent fundamental physics.
